title: Add Music page and front page preview for Synthetic Agondonters Collective

requirements.summary: Create a standalone Music page at /music route showcasing the Synthetic Agondonters Collective with a responsive grid of track cards linking to Suno profile
acceptanceCriteria: A `/music` route renders the Music page without errors
Track cards display title, a descriptive tag, and an outbound link to the Suno profile/track
Clicking a track card link opens https://suno.com/@nebacrypt in a new tab
Page layout is usable and well-structured on mobile (< 768px) and desktop (≥ 1024px)
Visual style (colors, fonts, spacing) is consistent with the rest of the site

file_operations.description: Create a reusable MusicTrackCard component that displays a track's title, descriptive genre tag, and an external link icon. The card should open https://suno.com/@nebacrypt in a new tab when clicked. Style using Tailwind classes consistent with the Nordic theme from index.css (OKLCH color tokens, border-radius from tailwind.config.js). Make the entire card clickable with hover states. The component accepts props: title (string), genreTag (string), and sunoUrl (string).

Create the MusicPage component that renders a full catalog of Synthetic Agondonters Collective tracks. Include a page header with title 'Synthetic Agondonters Collective' and a subtitle describing the music project. Display a responsive grid of MusicTrackCard components (1 column on mobile, 2-3 columns on tablet, 3-4 columns on desktop using Tailwind's grid-cols-* classes). Hardcode an array of 8-12 tracks with titles and genre tags (e.g., 'Ethereal Synth', 'Nordic Ambient', 'Electronic Dreams'). Each track card should link to https://suno.com/@nebacrypt. Use padding and spacing that matches LandingPage.tsx. Apply the Nordic color scheme from index.css.

requirements.summary: Add a compact music preview section on the Landing page displaying 2-3 highlighted tracks with a 'See all music' CTA linking to /music
acceptanceCriteria: Landing page contains a clearly identifiable music preview section
Section displays 2–3 track cards using the same component/design as the full Music page
A 'See all music' link is visible and navigates to the `/music` route
Section is responsive on both mobile and desktop
Section integrates visually with the existing LandingPage layout

file_operations.description: Add a new music preview section after the existing services section (before the 'why choose us' section). The section should have a heading 'Featured Music' or 'Synthetic Agondonters Collective', display 2-3 MusicTrackCard components in a responsive grid (1 column mobile, 2-3 columns desktop), and include a prominent 'See all music' call-to-action link/button that navigates to '/music' using React Router's Link component. Use the same track data structure as MusicPage.tsx but show only the first 2-3 tracks. Match the section styling, padding, and layout patterns used in the existing LandingPage sections. Import MusicTrackCard from '../components/MusicTrackCard'.

requirements.summary: Register the Music page route in App.tsx and add 'Music' navigation links to both desktop and mobile menus in Header.tsx
acceptanceCriteria: Navigating to `/music` loads the Music page
Desktop header contains a 'Music' nav link
Mobile hamburger menu contains a 'Music' nav link
Active state styling is applied to the Music nav link when on the `/music` route

file_operations.description: Import the MusicPage component from './pages/MusicPage'. Add a new Route element for the '/music' path that renders <MusicPage />. Place the route in the Routes section alongside existing routes for the landing page, admin dashboard, and client portal. Ensure the route is registered before any catch-all routes.

Add a 'Music' navigation link to both the desktop navigation menu and the mobile hamburger menu. For desktop: add a Link or button with text 'Music' that navigates to '/music', placed after existing nav items. For mobile: add a similar link in the mobile menu dropdown/overlay. Apply active state styling (using the same pattern as existing nav links) when the current route is '/music'. Use React Router's useLocation or NavLink to detect the active route. Ensure the link styling matches the existing navigation items (colors, hover states, typography from the Nordic theme).
